resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Pierre-Cécile Puvis de Chavannes (1824–1898) was a French symbolist painter known for his mural painting. He co-founded in 1890 the Société Nationale des Beaux-Arts, which exhibited in salons the work of his contemporary. As a representative of allegorical painting, he was heavily criticized when he started exhibiting his work at the Salon. The allegorical aspect of his work however made him the designated artist for the ornamentation of museums and city halls, and therefore received numerous requests from the state or from municipal governments to paint monumental paintings in public buildings. As a mural painter, he often worked outside of his studio. "French painter Pierre Puvis de Chavannes working on the decoration of the Paris Hôtel de ville", in L'Artiste, 1894. In his studios in Pigalle and Neuilly, he worked on smaller versions of his mural paintings, and original works on canvas. Pierre Puvis de Chavannes, Portrait of the artist, c. 1887, oil on canvas (France, Orsay Museum).
resource.chars:
Pierre-Cécile Puvis de Chavannes (1824–1898) was a French symbolist painter known for his mural painting. He co-founded in 1890 the Société Nationale des Beaux-Arts, which exhibited in salons the work of his contemporary.

As a representative of allegorical painting, he was heavily criticized when he started exhibiting his work at the Salon. The allegorical aspect of his work however made him the designated artist for the ornamentation of museums and city halls, and therefore received numerous requests from the state or from municipal governments to paint monumental paintings in public buildings. As a mural painter, he often worked outside of his studio.

"French painter Pierre Puvis de Chavannes working on the decoration of the Paris Hôtel de ville", in L'Artiste, 1894.

In his studios in Pigalle and Neuilly, he worked on smaller versions of his mural paintings, and original works on canvas.

Pierre Puvis de Chavannes, Portrait of the artist, c. 1887, oil on canvas (France, Orsay Museum).

resource.chars: This work is a small scale replica of The Sacred Grove, Beloved of the Arts and the Muses, a painting Chavannes realized in 1884 for the staircase of the Lyon Museum of Fine Arts.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Pierre Puvis de Chavannes, Ludus pro patria (Patriotic Games), c. 1883–89, oil on canvas, 33x134 cm (United States, New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art). This painting is a small-scale replica of a monumental painting Chavannes created for the staircase of the Picardie museum (Amiens) in 1882.
resource.chars:
